Keywords: Age of Apocalypse , Dark X-Men , Exiles , Monster , Morlocks , Scientist , X-Men
Real Name: Hank McCoy
Special Powers
MOVEMENT: Elevated
TAKE THIS ONE TO THE BREEDING PITS: During force construction, you may add a character on a starting line of 50 points or less to your Sideline and it becomes an Experiment. // Dark Beast starts the game with a Research token. When Dark Beast hits, give him a Research token.
YOU SHOW POTENTIAL: FREE: Choose an adjacent character. For each of Dark Beast's Research tokens, choose a standard power displayed on the Experiment's starting click. Until your next turn, the chosen character can use the chosen power(s).

October 24, 2021
Dortmuner
[QUOTE=Warborg;12163020]This could go the other way, right? Pick an Experiment to hinder your opponent. Find a piece with Battle Fury to quash their range or some Earthbound/Neutralised. It doesn't state friendly or opposing specifically[/QUOTE] This is probably better suited for the rules forum and you should post the power(s) you're referring to. Yes, you would be able to give an opposing character a power, since it doesn't specify friendly, only adjacent. The next question this begs is if there are characters of 50 points or fewer with EB/N or BF on their first click. EB/N, not so much. For Battle Fury, you do have a fairly good selection of characters, even modern clix, from which to choose. Mostly Carnages on the Marvel side, but others mixed in as well. It's probably going to be very situational that you can get adjacent to a predominantly range opposing character, give them Battle Fury for one turn, and get significant results for having done so. The other consideration is that, by my reading, you have to give the character one power for every Research token Dark Beast has. It's not "you may choose" or even "choose up to". It's choose a power for every Research token. So if Beast has hit anyone before you try to pull off this trick, you'll end up having to give the character not only Battle Fury, but Shape Change or BCF or Impervious or something else beneficial depending on the 50 point character you chose. So it makes it even more situational. TL;DR-Yes, it could go the other way. You're probably limited to a dozen modern clix you can use and only for Battle Fury. Using it to successfully keep an opposing clix from making a ranged combat attack for one round is likely highly situational and maybe not more valuable than just giving a friendly character extra good powers. It'd be good against Am I Blue Batman, for example. Someone that could make range attacks while adjacent. [B] Take This One to the Breeding Pits[/B]: During force construction, you may add a character on a starting line of 50 points or less to your Sideline and it becomes an Experiment. // Dark Beast starts the game with a Research token. When Dark Beast hits, give him a Research token. [B]Special You Show Potential: FREE[/B]: Choose an adjacent character. For each of Dark Beast's Research tokens, choose a standard power displayed on the Experiment's starting click. Until your next turn, the chosen character can use the chosen power(s).
